intro: Dianthera lutea, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow petals that form a bell-shaped bloom, which is typical of the Campanulaceae family. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance. Dianthera lutea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
